Subsets:

A set with elements has subsets (including ).

Example:



Example: 63

Start with 1 and 63.
Test integers up to
Factor pairs: (1,63), (3,21), (7,9) All factors: 1, 3, 7, 9, 21, 63



Consecutive Primes: Only 2 and 3 are consecutive.


LCM (Least Common Multiple):

Prime factor both numbers
Use highest powers of all primes
Example: 96 = 2^5 Ã— 3, 60 = 2^2 Ã— 3 Ã— 5 LCM = 2^5 Ã— 3 Ã— 5 = 480
GCF (Greatest Common Factor):

Prime factor both numbers
Use lowest powers of common primes
Example: 260 = 2^2 Ã— 5 Ã— 13, 156 = 2^2 Ã— 3 Ã— 13 GCF = 2^2 Ã— 13 = 52


Given: M = 77, n = 99, a = 55, b = 66
A = M^a mod n = 77^55 mod 99
B = M^b mod n = 77^66 mod 99
Key K = B^a mod n = A^b mod n
